Policy: Namibia’s Fourth National Development Plan 2012/13 to 2016/17.
Policy_Content: This document lays down Namibia’s Fourth National Development Plan (NDP), a multi-sectoral approach adopting the following three overarching goals: 1) high and sustained economic growth; 2) employment creation; 3) increased income equality. To reach these goals, this NDP has identified these key areas: logistics, tourism, manufacturing and agriculture. The Plan relates to the period from 2012 to 2017. The NDP is composed of four Sections. Section 1 defines the principles for implementation; Section 2 reflects on enablers that are the necessary conditions for economic development (including factors such as the institutional environment, education and skills, health, the reduction of extreme poverty, and public infrastructure); Section 3 focuses on economic priorities (logistics, tourism, manufacturing and agriculture); Section 4 sets out the execution strategy and a monitoring mechanism. Gender equality and the empowerment of women is among the objectives of the Plan.

Policy: National Sustainable Development Strategy : Pakistan’s pathway to a sustainable & resilient future 2012.
Policy_Content: The National Sustainable Development Strategy (NSDS) aims to define sustainable development and the pathway to a “green economy”. The focus was on integrating across the three overall dimensions of economic, social, environment and the goals with the aim to reach a more sustainability. The “Green Economy” model, being currently framed globally especially in the context of Rio+202 meeting, is a response to the environmental challenge, such as: mega-natural disasters, climate change, devastating floods, droughts, big cyclones, etc. Food security is the basic need for human as well as for social and economic development of any country. The Vision 2030 carves out the national vision as “an efficient and competitive sustainable agriculture ensuring food security and with ability to contribute to economic development and poverty alleviation”. In this context, the NSDS through detailed strategic goals, highlights the need to improve the overall governance in the country and addresses the challenges of delivery of essential services such as health and education for the people and encompasses the promotion of targeted social support policies and programmes that can lead to a reduction of inequalities and improvements in food security, energy security or security against natural and other calamities and emergencies. The primary focus is on establishing a just and progressive society, as is the objective of the “Green Action Agenda” through: Alleviation of poverty and promoting equity amongst society, in particular, through providing universal coverage of basic needs, particularly, health, education and welfare and using them as engines for an equitable green economy. Extending social protection and safety nets for the poorest and most vulnerable particularly women.

Policy: Stratégie de Développement de la Tunisie Nouvelle.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie de Développement de la Tunisie Nouvelle est un instrument stratégique multi-sectoriel à portée nationale qui a pour but de faire face aux problématiques de développement existantes et aux déséquilibres structurels ainsi que la consécration des aspirations et des revendications légitimes de la révolution qui sont l’emploi, le développement des régions intérieures, l’amélioration des conditions de vie et la justice sociale. Ses orientations visent la mise en place des fondements de bonne gouvernance, la consécration de la décentralisation et de la participation citoyenne, le développement régional, la modernisation de la structure économique, la consolidation de la productivité et l’établissement d’un système d'innovation ainsi que l'approfondissement de l'intégration dans l'économie mondiale, la valorisation des capacités nationales, en plus de la formation d'un partenariat durable entre les secteurs public et privé et la préservation de l'environnement. Les axes de la stratégie de développement sont: (1) mise en oeuvre d'une nouvelle génération de réformes économiques et sociales; (2) Modernisation de l'infrastructure; (3) Développement global et équilibré entre les régions; (4) Consolidation du développement humain et social; (5) Promotion du développement durable et gestion efficace des ressources naturelles.

Policy: Order No. 415 on harbour reception facilities for ship-generated waste, waste delivery and planning.
Policy_Content: The Order applies to the transportation of ship-generated waste. Reception facilities for ship-generated waste and cargo residues from ships must be established in every Danish port.  The Danish Nature Agency shall also grant companies shipping and/or receiving oil, ship-repairing companies and bunkering companies an injunction to establish facilities destined to the reception of oil mixed ballast, tank washing water, sewer waste-water. The owners of ports shall ensure that facilities are established in accordance with the Order's guidelines, and that these reception facilities are capable to receive hazardous substance waste as well. Passing/transit ships shall be exempt from the delivery of waste in Danish harbours if provided with sufficient evidence of an existingt system which ensures that the generated waste and payment of fees is planned in a port along the ship's route.

Policy: Regulation on environmental sanction fees (2012:259).
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets sanction fees with regard to environmental pollution control infringements. The fees shall be applied to provisions on wildlife reserves, agriculture, chemical products and biotechnical organisms, in adherence to EU regulations on chemical registration and classification (Chapter 7). The Regulation also applies to plant protection products and pesticides (Chapter 8) in adherence to EU Regulations on Plant Protection and Agriculture regulations on the use of pesticides particularly harmful to pollinating insects (chemical pesticides). Sanctions are also applied to fluorinated greenhouse gases and ozone-depleting substances in adherence to EU Regulation (Chapter 9). In Chapter 10, the Regulation applies to petrol gases and flammable liquids and implements Environmental Protection Agency’s regulations on the protection against soil and water pollution from their storage. In Chapter 11 the Regulation sets rules on recycling systems of electric products and shipment of waste.

Policy: Food Products/Animal Feed Safety, Veterinary and Plant Protection Code of Georgia (No. 6155-IS of 2012)
Policy_Content: This Code is the main act of legislation in the area of food safety, feed safety, veterinary control and plant protection in Georgia. Its purpose is to protect human life and health, consumer interests, animal health and welfare, and plant health, as well as to define the unified principles of state regulation and to form an effective system of state control in the fields of food/feed safety, veterinary and plant protection. The Code applies to the production, processing and distribution of food/feed, animals, plants, products of animal and plant origin in the territory of Georgia, to primary production, animal health and welfare, plant health, veterinary drugs, pesticides and agrochemicals, as well as to environmental protection based on the purpose of this Code. The Code regulates and determines the basic principles and requirements for food/feed safety; the types of state control in the fields of food/feed safety, veterinary and plant protection; the general requirements for the traceability of food/feed, animals, plants, products of animal and plant origin, veterinary drugs, pesticides and agrochemicals at the stages of production, processing and distribution; the competences of authorities in the areas of food/feed safety, veterinary and plant protection; the obligations of business operators; the basic requirements and conditions for animal health and welfare, and plant protection and health; veterinary and plant quarantine in the territory of Georgia; the requirements for the export and import of food/feed, animals, plants, products of animal and plant origin, veterinary drugs, pesticides and agrochemicals; and responsibility for violations of the requirements of this Code.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Loi sur la géoinformation (LGéo-VD).
Policy_Content: La présente loi fixe les dispositions d'application de la loi fédérale du 5 octobre 2007 sur la géoinformation (LGéo) et règle le traitement des géodonnées de base relevant du droit cantonal ou communal. L’article 2 établit que sauf dispositions contraires du droit fédéral ou cantonal, la loi régit à l'égard du canton et des communes: a) la saisie, la mise à jour et la gestion de leurs géodonnées de base; b) l'accès aux géodonnées de base et leur utilisation; c) l'introduction et la tenue du cadastre des restrictions de droit public à la propriété foncière; d) la mensuration officielle; e) le financement des tâches mentionnées sous lettres a, b, c et d ci-avant. Elle s'applique également aux autres géodonnées du canton et des communes sous réserve d'exceptions prévues par le droit cantonal ou communal. Le Conseil d'Etat dresse l'inventaire des géodonnées de base de droit cantonal. Lorsqu'elles gèrent des géodonnées de base de droit communal, les communes en dressent l'inventaire dans un catalogue. Le texte comprend 55 articles répartis en 6 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Principes (II); Mensuration officielle (III); Financement (IV); Dispositions pénales (V); Dispositions transitoires et finales (VI).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Loi forestière (LVLFO)
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour but d'assurer l'application de la législation fédérale sur les forêts. Elle vise en particulier à garantir la conservation des forêts dans leur étendue et leur répartition géographique; protéger les forêts en tant qu'écosystème naturel; garantir que les forêts remplissent durablement leurs fonctions, notamment environnementale, protectrice, sociale et économique; et maintenir et promouvoir l'économie forestière. Elle vise également à protéger la population et les biens d'une valeur notable contre les avalanches, les glissements de terrain, l'érosion et les chutes de pierres (dangers naturels). En matière de bilan de CO2, elle vise à valoriser la forêt et ses produits au sein des cycles de carbone, de manière à contribuer à la réduction des gaz à effets de serre. La présente loi s'applique à l'ensemble des forêts sises sur le territoire cantonal. Elle s'applique également à tous les secteurs exposés aux dangers naturels.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law on Environmental Impact Assessments (Revised).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of five Chapters, establishes the Environmental Impact Assessment requirements. It aims at protecting the environment and preventing environmental damages caused to natural resources with the fewest environmental impacts, according to provisions of art. 2 of the Constitution. Its purpose is to protect the environment, prevent ecological imbalance, ensure minimal adverse impacts on the environment from the use of natural resources, and regulate relations that may arise in connection with the assessment of environmental impacts of and approval decisions on regional and sectorial policies, development programs and plans and projects. The Law takes into consideration other laws and regulations related to environmental sector, and complies with the provisions of related international treaties. This Act is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I); Environmental Impact Assessment content and procedures (Chap. II); EIA participants' rights and obligations (Chap. Policy: Law No. 17.142 providing for the State Policy to Support Cooperatives within the State of Paraná.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting 9 articles, establishes the State Policy to Support Cooperatives within the State of Paraná. This State Policy aims at regulating the activities carried out by the Public and Private Power, benefiting directly or indirectly all branches of the cooperative sector through the promotion of social, economic and cultural development, according the Constitution of the State of Paraná. The State of Paraná will exercise the functions of incentive and planning, supporting and stimulating cooperatives and developing mechanisms to facilitate the creation, maintenance and development of cooperatives. The objectives of the State Policy are: to provide technical, financial and operational support to cooperatives in the State, promoting an operational partnership for the development of the cooperative system, with a special emphasis on the improvement of organizational models, especially in social inclusion and development with sustainable and autonomous bases for the diverse sectors of the society; to stimulate the cooperative form of social, economic and cultural organization in the various branches of action, based on the general principles of cooperatives and current legislation; to encourage the inclusion of the study of cooperative in schools, aiming to change the organizational parameters of all branches of cooperative; publicize government policies for the sector, articulating processes for a strategy building, through the creation of a State Council of Cooperatives; to promote capacity building for aspiring or already associated citizens in cooperatives, supporting the elaboration and constitution of the state programme of support to cooperative, based on the Cooperative State Council and strategies that allow training actions and improvement of this model of organization; to promote the development and self-management of all branches of cooperatives, especially in the field of labour, legally constituted, in accordance with its current legislation; to establish tax treatment to cooperatives; to encourage the creation, maintenance and development of cooperatives, regulating legal obligations.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto las bases para la formulación e instrumentación de las políticas públicas para la adaptación al cambio climático, la mitigación de sus efectos adversos, con el fin de proteger a la población y coadyuvar al desarrollo sustentable. Asimismo la Ley fija las bases de coordinación institucional entre las dependencias del Gobierno del Estado, los Municipios y el Gobierno Federal en materia de vulnerabilidad, riesgo, prevención, adaptación y mitigación ante el cambio climático. Policy: Regional Law No. 22 "On some issues of turnover of agricultural land".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some relations concerning turnover of agricultural land and land shares in common property. Minimum consolidated land plot shall be equal to 5, 0 ha. Maximum agricultural land plot area that can be owned by a single household or by a single legal person within a single administrative unit shall be twenty percent of total available agricultural land area within the boundaries of a single municipal unit. Regional administration and local government shall have preferential terms for purchase of agricultural land in case of sale thereof, except for sale through public tenders. Agricultural organizations and peasant farms having agricultural land plots on condition of permanent (open-ended) or hereditary tenancy shall be granted the right of purchase in ownership thereof at the price of 15 percent of cadastre value of the aforesaid agricultural land plots.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates some issues related to turnover of agricultural land, including agricultural land parcels and agricultural land shares in common ownership of agricultural land. It shall not be applicable to agricultural land parcels allotted to citizens for subsidiary smallholding, gardening, horticulture and cattle breeding. Authorized regional institution in the sphere of agricultural land turnover shall have the following competence: (a) acceptance, registration and examination of applications for allotment of agricultural land; (b) decision-making of tenders for sale or lease of agricultural land; and (c) purchase into state ownership parcels of agricultural land. Minimum land area of newly consolidated agricultural land shall be 5.0 ha, maximum agricultural land area that can be owned by a single natural or legal person shall not exceed 20 percent of total agricultural land area available on regional territory at the moment of allotment or purchase.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 60 adapting the Greek legislative framework to the provisions of Council Directive 2009/71/EURATOM establishing a Community framework for the nuclear safety of nuclear installations.
Policy_Content: With this Presidential Decree the Greek legislative framework is adapted towards the provisions of Council Directive 2009/71/EURATOM establishing a Community framework for the nuclear safety of nuclear installations. Its provisions aim at: 1) maintaining a high level of nuclear safety of the nuclear installations in the Greek territory through: a) the completion and extension of already existing legislation, in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 3 of article 2, as well as with paragraphs 1 and 2 of article 5 of Legislative Decree No. 854/1971 “regarding the terms of establishment and operation of nuclear installations”, and b) the establishment of additional measures for the better possible operation of this framework. 2) future adoption of national nuclear safety regulations and arrangements to protect workers, the general public and the environment in Greece against the dangers arising from ionizing radiations from nuclear installations. The Greek Committee of Nuclear Energy (Ελληνική Επιτροπή Ατομικής Ενέργειας - EEAE) is established as the responsible regulating Body in the field of nuclear safety of nuclear installations. It oversees the observation of the provisions of the present Decree and ensures that the provisions in question are implemented, according to the safety requirements of the International Atomic Energy Agency, the National Regulations against radiations as well as the remaining National Regulations that are related to nuclear safety.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
Entry into force notes: The Decree shall enter into force on 22.7.2011 except from the provisions of point c, paragraph 1 of article 4 and paragraph 6 of article 5 which shall enter into force as from the day of its publication on the Official Gazette.

Policy: Air Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Act defines objectives for ambient air quality: air protection, the prevention of air pollution and reducing the level of pollution in order to reduce the risks to human health caused by air pollution, reduce the level of substances damaging ecosystems and create conditions for the regeneration of the environment affected due to pollution air. This Act implementes the relevant European Union regulations and defines: (a) permitted levels of pollution and air pollution; (b) method of assessing acceptable levels of pollution and air pollution; (c) measures to reduce pollution and air pollution; (d) rights and obligations of persons and the competence of public administration at the air protection; (e) rights and obligations of public authorities to monitor and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transport fuels. The present Act consists of 44 articles divided into the following Sections: (1) Introductory provisions; (2) Pollution; (3) Measures to reduc pollution; (4) Obligations of persons and sustainability criteria for biofuels; (5) Remedial measures and administrative offences; (6) State administration; (7) Transitional regime for combustion plants; (8) Common and transitional provisions; (9) Entry into force.

Policy: Order No. 408 on assessment criteria for municipal projects with regard to phosphorus wetlands.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations with regard to the criteria for assessing municipal projects undertaken to improve aquatic and terrestrial environments by reducing phosphorus loads (phosphorus wetlands), and for which subsidy is requested in accordance to the Danish AgriFish Agency's Order on funding for municipal projects concerning phosphorus wetlands.  The project areas shall be located upstream of specific lakes in order to reduce the phosphorus load in water, and criteria for financial grants shall include the reduction of phosphorus of less than 20 kg/ha yearly (1), that the project is cost-effective (2), that the project will be implemented through the establishment of natural hydrological processes (3), that there must be a high risk of phosphorus release from the soil in the project area (4), that the project's effect on washing out ocher is included in the assessment of the application (5), that the project shall not have a negative impact on the wild plant and animal life (6), and that the project's impact on Natura2000-areas and animal and plant species are evaluated in the application. The project must not cause damages to a Natura2000-area, destruction of breeding sites or resting places of protected species.

Policy: DENR Memorandum Circular No. 2012-01 establishing the Implementation of the National Greening Programme.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the Implementation of the National Greening Programme. In order to have an effective implementation of the National Greening Programme (NGP), pursuant to Executive Order No. 26, it is directed to: Stress the importance of trees protective function; Identify, survey and map contiguous planting sites; Prioritize the identified poor municipalities by the National Anti-Poverty Commission (NAPC) and the National Convergence Initiative (NCI) areas for development; In coordination with Peoples' Organizations (POs) and LGUs concerned on identified planting sites, identify and propagate on-site species of forest trees, fruit-bearing trees, industrial crops, fuelwood and bamboo species for planting in production forests, preferably indigenous species; Provide technical support to partner POs and CSOs to ensure high rates of seedlings; Engage the PTFCF's and FPE's assisted CSOs in the production and planting of indigenous forest species pursuant to the MOA among DENR and the PTFCF and FPE. CENROs/PENROs shall submit to the REDS concerned for consolidation and submission to the Office of the Secretary through the Office of the Undersecretary for Field Operations, the list of CSOs engaged in the production of indigenous species, and plantation establishment, maintenance and protection, for monitoring and evaluation purposes; Implement plantation maintenance and protection activities in all NGP planting sites; Adopt the use of the NGP computer-based reporting system through the NGP website and the NGP geo-tagging M&E system; Implement the MOAs between the DENR and national government agencies and other partner organizations such as the PNP, SUCs, MAP, private business, among others, by providing planting sites, technical assistance and other appropriate support to ensure successful implementation of the Agreement.

Policy: National Action Plan on Elimination of the Worst Forms of Child Labour in Uganda 2012/13 - 2016/17.
Policy_Content: The National Action Plan on Elimination of the Worst Forms of Child Labour is a national policy with a multi-sectoral approach. This Plan primarily targets children engaged in the worst forms of child labour as well as Children at risk of Child Labour. The timeframe of the Plan is 6 years between 2012/2013 and 2016/2017. The overall goal of the Plan is to reduce the magnitude of the Worst Forms of Child Labour by 2017 by (i) promoting primary level education and increasing access to appropriate skills training programs for children, (ii) increasing  access to social protection and social assistance services for households, (iii) raising public awareness on the causes and consequences of the worst forms of child labour, (iv) strengthening the legal, policy and institutional framework for prevention, (v) withdrawing and rehabilitating children engaged in the WFCL and integrating them back to their families and communities, and (vi) strengthening cooperation between among government, the employers and labour unions in addressing the problem of child labour.

Policy: Decree No.5 of 2012 issuing the Regulation on Industrial Waste Water Transportation.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consisting of 21 articles divided in V Chapters aims at (i) establishing an appropriate system to control the transport and disposal of industrial effluents in safe environmental ways that prevent direct and indirect effects that are harmful to the public health, safety and well-being; (ii) establishing a database about quality, quantity and sources of industrial effluents; (iii) determining procedures for the transfer of liquid industrial waste to be met by the producer, the carrier, and the disposal facility for industrial effluents; (iv) providing a monitoring system for trucks control by satellite; (v) providing an automated system for registering companies that are qualified for the transfer of industrial effluents; and (vi) reducing the environmental pollution resulting from the dumping of industrial effluents in other than designated sites. Responsible body shall be the Environment Public Authority (EPA) and the related departments. The EPA Director shall form a Committee, which main tasks are qualification and classification of the industrial liquid waste transport companies, setting the conditions and controls required for companies classification, studying the most common violations, and making recommendations to withdraw the license or temporarily suspend the license.

Policy: European Communities (Conservation of Wild Birds (Magharee Islands Special Protection Area 004125)) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 139 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations designate a foreshore and wetlands area as a Special Protection Area in accordance with Article 4 of Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Conservation of Wild Birds. The purpose is to ensure survival and reproduction of all species of birds to which Article 4 relates and in particular those listed in Schedule 3 to these Regulations. Schedule 4 lists activities that require the consent of the Minister and may cause disturbance or damage to birds protected under Schedule 3. The bird species listed in that Schedule are protected to ensure their survival and reproduction in their area of distribution. Activities that require consent of the Minister include: burning, topping, clearing scrub or rough vegetation or reseeding; introduction, or re-introduction, of plants or animals not found in the area; water abstraction, sinking of boreholes and wells; planting of trees or multi-annual bioenergy crops; and intensifying grazing and presence of livestock. There is no requirement to obtain the consent of the Minister if: (a) the operation or activity is licensed by or subject to the permission of another public authority; or (b) the operation or activity is specified as permitted in a farm or land management plan (subject to compliance with any conditions set out therein). Also no consent is required for clearing activities on established reseeded grassland or cultivated land provided it is greater than 20 meters from a river, stream or floodplain; or greater than 50 meters from a wetland, lake, turlough or pond.

Policy: Kiribati Development Plan 2012-2015
Policy_Content: The present Kiribati Development Plan (KDP) has been founded on the basis of two guiding principles namely: socio protection/gender equity and results based management. The following key objectives have been set out: Key Objective 1: The national development priority will be to improve functional literacy and numeracy through access to quality and relevant education and to provide professional skills development opportunities and technical capacity for the citizens of Kiribati by the year 2015. Key Objective 2: One of the national development priority will be to effectively implement structural and fiscal reforms under the Kiribati Economic Reform Priorties Program. Key Objective 3: The national development priority will be to increase access to (and delivery of) quality health services including health awareness and healthy lifestyles so as to improve health and well-being for all Kiribati citizens by the year 2015. Key Objective 4: The national development priority will be to facilitate sustainable development by responding and mitigating the effects of global climate change and through approaches that protect island biodiversity and supports the reduction of environmental degradation by the year 2015 through deployment of the strategies mentioned in this Plan. Key Objective 5: The Government of Kiribiti seeks to facilitate sustainable development by responding and mitigating the effects of climate change through approaches that protect biodiversity and supports the reduction and management of environmental degradation by the year 2015. Key Objective 6: The national development priority will be to facilitate economic growth, trade, industrialization and well-being for technological and social transformation through the development of new/upgrade of physical infrastructure such as sea passages/airports and roads by the year 2015.

Policy: Regulation on detailed requirements for development projects of deposits.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of four paragraphs, establishes detailed requirements for development projects of deposits. Such projects should specify: (1) optimal variant of the rational use of resources of the deposit, in particular through a comprehensive and rational use of the main mineral and associated minerals, including:  geological conditions of occurrence of the deposit, technical possibilities and economic determinants of mineral exploitation, and the expected way of decommissioning mines, conservation of resources left after the exploitation and reclamation of land after mining activities; (2) actions necessary to protect the environment, including technology that reduces the adverse impact on the environment.

En particular, introduce la definición de servicios ambientales y se incluye la protección y restauración de estos últimos entre los objetivos perseguidos tanto por la Ley como por la Ley General de Desarrollo Forestal Sustentable. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 373 validating Regulation on permanent state supervision at nuclear energy sites.

Policy: Regulation of Preparation, Procurement and Distribution of Registered Wheat Seeds and Chemical Fertilizer
Policy_Content: The Regulation aims to facilitate the economic development of agricultural cooperatives and individual farmers and to provide food security in the country.  The Regulation consists of 5 Chapters, which divided into 27 articles: General Provisions (I); Duties and Responsibilities (II); The Process of Purchasing seeds and Chemical fertilizers (III); Seeds and Fertilizers Distribution Committee (IV); Final Provisions (V).  Main objectives of this Regulation include: to purchase approved wheat seeds from confident resources, such as registered companies; to improve financial capabilities of agricultural cooperatives and individual farmers; to facilitate sustainable agricultural development; to distribute approved varieties of wheat seeds; to encourage agricultural cooperatives to cultivate halal, permitted and reasonable plants and to reduce drug cultivation; to develop seeds production industry; to improve the wheat products quality. The Department of Agricultural Development is responsible to manage and monitor the process of preparing, purchasing, provision, and distribution of seeds and chemical fertilizers. The Department of Production and Improvement of Cereals has duties to: prepare annual plan for purchase of seeds; to constantly inspect farms; to allocate the available budget to different provinces; to cooperate with National Union of Seeds; to collect information. According to the Regulation, the FAO’s laboratory in Afghanistan is required to take the necessary test from seeds and issue authorization, tag the approved seeds with essential information and hold workshops for farm inspectors.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 350 validating the federal target program "Development of the water management complex of the Russian Federation for the period of 2012 - 2020".
Policy_Content: Federal Target Program "Development of the water management complex of the Russian Federation for the period of 2012 - 2020" is a multisectoral policy document. The objectives of the Program shall be as follows: (a) guaranteed provision of water resources for sustainable social and economic development of the Russian Federation; (b) conservation and restoration of waterbodies to a state ensuring ecofriendly living conditions of the population; (c) ensuring protection of the population and business facilities from floods and other negative impact of water. Targets of the Program shall be as follows: (a) to eliminate local water shortages in water-deficient regions of the Russian Federation; (b) to improve the rational use of water resources; (c) to reduce the negative anthropogenic impact on waterbodies; (d) to restore and rehabilitate waterbodies; (e) to increase the operational reliability of waterworks (including ownerless ones) by bringing them to a safe technical condition; (f) to ensure the protection of the population and economic facilities from the negative impact of waters;  (g) to develop and modernize state monitoring system of waterbodies; and (h) to educate and inform the population in relation to management and protection of waterbodies. In order to achieve the guaranteed supply of water resources for sustainable socio-economic development of the Russian Federation, it is planned to solve the following tasks: (a) to eliminate water shortages in water-deficit regions of the Russian Federation; and (b) to improve the rational use of water resources.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2012-369 du 18 avril 2012 modifiant la loi n° 96-669 portant Code pétrolier.
Policy_Content: L’Etat exerce sur l’ensemble du territoire de la République de Côte d’Ivoire, sa mer territoriale, sa zone économique exclusive et son plateau continental des droits souverains aux fins des opérations pétrolières. Nul ne peut entreprendre des opérations, même le propriétaire de la surface, s’il n’y a pas été préalablement autorisé conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi. L’Etat peut entreprendre directement des opérations pétrolières, soit en les réalisant lui-même, soit en les faisant réaliser pour son compte par des personnes morales ivoiriennes de droit public. L’Etat peut également autoriser des personnes morales de nationalité ivoirienne ou de nationalité étrangère à réaliser des opérations pétrolières en exécution d’un contrat pétrolier conclu par ces personnes avec l’Etat, conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi. S’il y a lieu, l’Etat peut également accorder des autorisations de reconnaissance d’hydrocarbures dont les fins sont uniquement d’information technique.

Policy: Plan d’Action National pour l’Environnement 2012-2016 (PANE 2).
Policy_Content: Dans la perspective de fournir au pays un cadre cohérent d’actions pour la bonne gouvernance environnementale en général, et pour la lutte contre la dégradation des ressources naturelles en particulier, la Mauritanie a élaboré un Plan d’Action National pour l’Environnement 2012-2016 (PANE 2), fondé sur une approche participative de tous les acteurs concernés. Il s’agit d’un plan sectoriel d’une portée nationale qui vise la mise en place d’un cadre cohérent pour toutes les interventions qui concourent à la réalisation des objectifs de la politique environnementale de la Mauritanie. L’objectif général du plan est le développement et l’utilisation des meilleurs approches pour la protection de l’environnement et la gestion durable de ses ressources naturelles.

Policy: Law No. 820 “On apiculture”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the sphere of apiculture production, use and protection of bees, efficient use thereof for pollination of agricultural crops, increase of the output of apiculture products and ensuring guarantees to natural and legal persons carrying out apiculture activity. Apiculture can be exercised by natural and legal persons as a form of entrepreneurial activity or as activity destined for individual personal needs. Bee farmers can form bee farming associations. The number of bee families owned by natural and legal persons shall be unlimited, except for restrictions imposed by local self-government of number of bee families and apiaries located in urban and inhabited areas in accordance with veterinary and sanitary regulations, and restrictions on the number on bee families and apiaries located in non-commercial subsidiary small-holding and horticulture cooperatives imposed by decision of the assembly of the members of cooperatives. Bee families and apiaries shall be subject to state registration. Natural and legal persons cultivating entomophilous plant, in order to raise yield thereof, can use bee families, owned by other persons, for pollination in accordance with contracts concluded with bee owners. Basic requirements for the protection of honeybees shall be: (a) protection of natural habitats, movement and migratory routes thereof; and (b) veterinary and sanitary servicing of honeybees.

Policy: Law No. 818 “On environmental audit”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes principles and modalities of conducting environmental audit and is aimed at prevention of negative environmental impact of projected economic activity.  Basic principles of state policy in the sphere of environmental audit shall be: (a) assumption of ecological hazardousness of projected economic activity; (b) obligatoriness of state environmental audit; (c) obligatoriness of consideration of ecological safety in the process of environmental audit; (d) reliability and completeness of information submitted for environmental audit; (e) independence of experts; and (f) transparency and public participation. Environmental audit shall achieve the following goals: (a) efficiency assessment of measures adopted for the protection of public health, rational management of natural resources and environmental protection; (b) assessment of correct evaluation of ecological risks by the customer; and (c) assessment of possible ecologically negative impact on environment. Environmental audit shall be state and public. Period of validity of state environmental audit shall be limited to the period of project realization.

Policy: Kenya Water Towers Agency Order, 2012 (L.N. No. 27 of 2012).
Policy_Content: This Order establishes a state corporation to be known as the Kenya Water Towers Agency. The Agency shall, among other things: (a) coordinate and oversee the protection, rehabilitation, conservation, and sustainable management of water towers; (b) coordinate and oversee the recovery and restoration of forest lands, wetlands and biodiversity hot spots (i.e. unique habitat with rare and diverse animals, organisms and endangered species, which is under threat of extinction); (c) promote the implementation of sustainable livelihood programmes in the water towers in accordance with natural resource conservation; (d) mobilize resources from the Government, development partners and other stakeholders as well as through payment for environmental services, including carbon reservoirs and sequestration; and (e) in consultation with the relevant stakeholders, identify water towers and watersheds for protection.

Policy: Arrêté n° 011/MCPSP/CAB/DPSP du 13 avril 2012 relatif aux formalités d’entreprises au Togo
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté approuve les formalités d’entreprises au Togo. La création, la modification et la dissolution d'entreprises au Togo sont soumises aux formalités suivantes : l’immatriculation au registre du commerce et du crédit mobilier (RCCM) ; la déclaration d'existence a la direction générale des impôts (DGI) ; et l'inscription à la caisse nationale de sécurité sociale (CNSS) et à l'inspection du travail et des lois sociales (ITLS). Les déclarations de suretés sont régies par les dispositions légales et règlementaires en vigueur notamment celles de I' Acte Uniforme OHADA portant organisation des sûretés. Les formalités de création, de modification et de dissolution des entreprises sont accomplies auprès des administrations suivantes représentées au sein du guichet unique : le greffe du tribunal ; la direction générale des impôts ; et la caisse nationale de sécularité sociale et l'inspection du travail et des lois sociales. Peuvent être accomplies, en cas de nécessite, après création de l'entreprise : l'inscription au registre de la Chambre de commerce et d'industrie du Togo ; l'établissement de la carte d'importateur/exportateur ; et l'autorisation d'exercice pour les activités règlementées.

Policy: Law No. 4650-IV “On particulars of privatization of coal mining enterprises”.
Policy_Content: This Law determines the particulars of legal, economic and organizational regulation of privatization of state property of coal mining enterprises and the particulars of their functioning in post-privatization period. This Law establishes moratorium of three years from the date of completion of privatization on forced sale of the property pertaining to the objects of privatization through stopping of the execution thereof. This Law also concerns re-issuance of ownership certificate to the buyer (investor) and re-issuance of mining licence without tender. The object of privatization shall include mining enterprises, surface mines and mine offices. Privatization shall be organized and regulated by the central state executive body in the sphere of coal and mining complex. Privatization shall be carried through tender and investment competition.

Policy: Ngāti Pāhauwera Treaty Claims Settlement Act 2012 (No. 30 of 2012).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act, consisting of 123 sections divided into three Parts and four Schedules, is to give effect to certain provisions of the deed ofsettlement, which is a deed thatsettlesthe historical claims of Ngāti Pāhauwera. Part 1 provides for: the effect of the settlement on the jurisdiction of a court, tribunal, or other judicial body in respect of the historical claims; consequential amendments to the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975; the effect of the settlement on certain memorials; the exclusion of the law against perpetuities, the timing of actions or matters provided for in this Act, and access to the deed of settlement. Part 2 provides for cultural redress, including:  the vesting in the trustees of the Ngāti Pāhauwera Tiaki Trust of the fee simple estate in Te Heru o Tūreia to hold on behalf of Ngāti Pāhauwera and the immediate gifting of Te Heru o Tūreia Gift Area to the Crown to be administered as a historic reserve, the requirement for the Ngāti Pāhauwera Tiaki Trust to provide a registrable conservation covenant over Te Heru o Tūreia (Area B), and the declaration of Nakunaku (a site within Te Heru o Tūreia) as a historic reserve; the vesting in the trustees of the Ngāti Pāhauwera Tiaki Trust of the fee simple estate in other cultural redress properties; the right to manage the extraction of relevant hāngi stones, etc.

Policy: TECHNICAL STANDARDS on the use, conservation and development of forests in the Republic of Moldova.
Policy_Content: Forests, land subject to afforestation, land of forest-cultural, industrial or forestry purposes, ponds, riverbeds, as well unproductive lands covered by forest management, in accordance with the current legislation form the national forest fund, regardless of the type of property and ownership. Forest areas covered with forest vegetation, of an area of more than 0.25 hectares, which are part of the national forest fund shall be classified as forests. Depending on the type of property, the national forest fund consists of forest fund, which is in the public domain (public property of the state and public property of administrative-territorial units), and of the forest fund privately owned (physical and legal persons) and is a national domain. Land of the forest fund, which is used for other purposes and does not belong to the given owner of the forest fund, are reflected in the materials of forest management as special forest areas if it is not located nearby public roads. In accordance with the main functions, forests shall be classified as the first category - forests, performing exclusively the functions of environmental protection. According to the functions performed, the forests of the first category are divided into the following subgroups of forest protection: (a) forests with water protection functions; (b) forests with soil protection functions; (c) forests with protection functions against unfavorable climatic and industrial factors; (d) forests with recreational functions; and (e) forests of scientific importance and on preservation of the forest gene pool and ecological fund. Central executive body in the sphere of forestry shall be responsible for management of the national forest fund. Forest inventory is a system of technical, economic and legal accounting through qualitative and quantitative assessment, detection and registration, as well as topographic image on maps and plans for real estate (land and buildings) on the territory of the forest fund. The organization of the forest inventory, which is a subsystem of the general cadastre, is the prerogative of the central forestry management body. Forest management is the basis of forest inventory. As a result of forest management is obtained the data and information required for the development of the corresponding cadastre, namely: (a) identification of the owner of the immovable property; (b) the area of the forest fund and the areas constituting the cadastral quarter; (c) category of use and category of land quality; (d) placement of forestry units within the territorial units of general cadastre; and (e) use of forest management plans and maps during compilation of cadastral plans and maps. The structure of plantations and forests, both normal and relevant to various intermediate stages, is determined by establishment forestry bases: mode, composition - purpose, method of felling, maturation (expressed the age of maturity in full-grown forest with an even distribution classes of age), turnover of cuttings. The regulation of the forest management process is carried out by way of establishment of rated wood cutting and development of plans for logging and forest cultivation. Collection of field data on sanitary condition in relation to information received in the framework of forest monitoring, as well as data on the sanitary condition of forests, obtained in the framework of forestry, is performed in compliance with the requirements of the forestry directory. Owners/managers of the forest fund must take the necessary measures related to forest management for periodic inspection of forest management practices in accordance with the current legislation.

Policy: Decree No. 57.933 reorganizing the Secretariat of the Environment.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 147 articles divided into twelve Chapters and two Annexes, reorganizes the Secretariat of the Environment. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Secretariat of the Environment within the State of São Paulo. The Secretariat is a sectional body of the National Environmental System (SISNAMA), established by Federal Law 6.938 of 31 August 1981, and the central organ of the State System of Environmental Management, Protection, Control and Development of the Appropriate Use of Natural Resources (SEAQUA), constituted by Law No. 9,509 of 20 March 1997. It is entitled to perform the following activities: a) coordinating the process of formulation, approval, execution, evaluation and updating of the State Environmental Policy, which is dealt with in Law No. 9.509 of 20 March 1997; b) analysing and monitoring sectoral public policies having impact on the environment; c) regulating environmental licensing and inspection in the State, which must be followed by all SEAQUA executing agencies and entities, in particular by CETESB - Companhia Ambiental do Estado de São Paulo; d) approving plans, programmes and budgets of organs and entities executing the State Environmental Policy and the coordination of their execution; e) coordinating plans and actions resulting from the State Environmental Policy with sectoral and local bodies and entities; f) managing policies, plans and environmental actions; g) environmental control, aiming at the sustainable development of the State; h) coordination.

Policy: Décret n° 2012-067/PR/MPF du 4 avril 2012 portant création et organisation du Conseil national de l'Enfant (CNE).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un Conseil National de l'Enfant (CNE) qui est l'organe national de supervision de la mise en oeuvre du PASNED. Il sera chargé de mesurer les progrès accomplis dans le domaine de l'enfance et de proposer des orientations politiques et stratégiques. Le Conseil National de l'Enfant (CNE) a pour mission de : promouvoir les droits de l'enfant par la mise en oeuvre du PASNED, notamment par des activités pédagogiques, l'élaboration d'avant projets de textes législatifs et réglementaires visant à garantir un meilleur respect des droits de l’enfant à soumettre au gouvernement ; coordonner les actions menées par les différents intervenants dans le domaine des droits et de la protection de l'enfance ; contribuer à l'élaboration et à la validation des politiques générales et stratégies de développement de l'enfance ; veiller à l'intégration de la dimension enfant dans les programmes de développement nationaux et des plans d'action annuels des départements sectoriels en étroite collaboration avec les ministères techniques concernés, en vue de la promotion, la protection et la réalisation des droits de l'enfant aux niveaux sanitaire, nutritionnel, éducatif, affectif, créatif de protection sociale et de participation des enfants, avec une attention particulière aux enfants les plus vulnérables ; effectuer un plaidoyer soutenu auprès des décideurs nationaux, en particulier ceux concernés par les politiques et le budget national ; faire le plaidoyer pour l'octroi d'une part du budget national de l'Etat à l'enfant ; documenter toutes les situations de violence, d'abus, de négligence ou d'exploitation faites sur des enfants ; élaborer un rapport semestriel sur l'état d'exécution du PASNED et des politiques, des programmes et des plans d'action sectoriels visant l'enfant ; assurer le suivi de l'élaboration, la validation, la soumission et la soutenance des rapports nationaux faisant état de la mise en oeuvre des instruments juridiques régionaux et internationaux relatifs aux droits de l'enfant ; et assurer le suivi de la mise en oeuvre des recommandations internationales relatives à la réalisation et à la protection des droits des enfants.

Policy: Law No. 290-IV “On migration.”
Policy_Content: In accordance with the Constitution and universally recognized norms of international law, this Law establishes the procedure for the entry into, stay in and departure from the country of Turkmen citizens, foreign nationals and stateless persons, and defines the legal relations in the area of migration in Turkmenistan and the competence of Government bodies to regulate migration processes in Turkmenistan. Labour migration shall be intended lawful voluntary movement of natural persons permanently residing in Turkmenistan, outside Turkmenistan, as well as foreign citizens and stateless persons, permanently residing in foreign countries and coming to Turkmenistan for the purpose of employment. Illegal migration shall be intended entry into and stay in Turkmenistan in violation of Turkmenistan legislation. Administrative expulsion shall be intended forced and controlled movement of foreign nationals, stateless persons through the State border of Turkmenistan beyond its borders in cases, envisaged by Turkmenistan legislation. Regulation of migration processes in Turkmenistan is based on the following principles: (a) ensuring human rights enshrined in the Constitution to free choice of place of residence, type of activity and profession and freedom of movement; (b)  prohibition to infringe individual rights and freedoms on grounds of ethnic background, race, sex, origin, wealth, official status, place of residence, language, attitude to religion, political convictions, party affiliation or lack thereof, or for other reasons; (c) ensuring compliance of Turkmenistan legislation with universally recognized norms of international law and international agreements on migration; (d) detection, prevention and suppression of illegal migration in Turkmenistan; (e) respect for and compliance with Turkmenistan legislation by migrants; (f) cooperation between Government bodies and public associations in regulating internal migration processes; and (g) participation of Government bodies in regulating external migration processes. This Law consists of VIII Chapters divided into 51 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regulates entry into, stay in, and exit from Turkmenistan of foreign citizens and stateless persons. Chapter III regards Turkmenistan residence permits. Chapter IV regards migration control in Turkmenistan. Chapter V regulates exit from ad entry into Turkmenistan of Turkmen citizens. Chapter VI regards internal migration. Chapter VII establishes liability for the violation of Turkmenistan legislation on migration. Chapter VIII lays down final provisions.

Policy: Farmland Law (Pyidaungsu Hluttaw Law No. ll of 2012).
Policy_Content: This Farmland Law, consisting of XIII Chapters, establishes the requirements for benefitting from the Right for Farming as follows: A person who has the permission of right to use farmland shall have to apply for getting the Land Use Certificate to the Township Land Records Department Office passing it through the relevant Ward or Village Tract Farmland Management Body. With respect to Section 4 of this law, the Office of Township Land Records Department shall scrutinize and submit the cases of right to use farmland to the relevant Township Farmland Management Body. The Township Farmland Management Body shall issue the Land Use Certificate to the following person or organization with respect to existing farmland on the day of enforcement date of this law, by the approval of District Farmland Management Body, after paid the prescribed registration fees and registered at the Township Land Records Department's Office. The following rights shall be enjoyed in connection with the right for farming: right to have such land in hand, right for farming and gain benefit of such farm; right to sell, pawn, lease, exchange, or donate, in whole or in part of the right for farming in accord with prescribed disciplines; disputes arising out of inheritance of farmland shall be decided upon by the law respective court in accord with existing law; the duration of the right for farming shall continue so long as the stipulated conditions are not breached; land development operation are to be carried out by doing joint-venture with the investment of rural cooperative association or private investors; in accordance with Foreign Investment Law, foreigner or organization containing foreigner are to be carried out by doing joint-venture; The provisions under the section 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9 of this law shall not apply to the allocation of alluvial land.

Policy: Law No. 4062 on the development of the Hellenikon former airport site − the SUN Program − Promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources (Incorporation of Directive 2009/28/EK) – Sustainability criteria for bio-fuel (Directive 2009/30/EK incorporation).
Policy_Content: The law, consisting of 41 articles, is composed by four Parts: Part A provides for the enactment of the development framework plan for the Hellenikon area and the coastal area of Agios Kosmas. This part, consisting of 9 articles, regulates critical issues concerning the combined development of the former airport site, the Olympic Centre of Sailing and the Athletic Centre for Youth of Agios Kosmas, which all together compose the Metropolitan Pole of Hellinikon – Agios Kosmas. With Part B (articles 10-13), the law establishes the necessary framework for the implementation of the national energy program (called SUN), which mainly aims at: a) exporting and commercializing solar energy from Greece to Central European countries; this objective also contributes to achieving the national objective of settling the public debt, and b) promoting international collaboration within the framework of European policies as regards climate change, increasing production of electric energy from renewable sources and facilitating transport of this energy in trans-European energy networks. Part C (articles 14-34) of the law sets forth the provisions necessary for the effective transposition into the national legislative framework of EU Directive 2009/28/EC on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources. It also harmonizes the Greek legislation with articles 2 and 7a up to 7e of EU Directive 98/70/EC relating to the quality standards of petrol and diesel fuels. Part D (articles 35-41) deals with transitional and final provisions. More specifically, with the provisions of Part C: a) Law No. 3468/2006 is supplemented and amended accordingly as regards the calculation for the overall share of energy from renewable sources, the cooperation mechanisms between Member States and/or other third countries which allow them to agree on the extent to which one Member State supports the energy production in another, the guarantees of origin, the reports and the national plan of action on renewable energy, the normalization for the charge of hydropower and wind power  electric energy production, the energy production from heat pumps, as well as the energy efficiency in transport; b) biofuels are distinct, depending on the use, in biofuels (liquid or gaseous fuel) for transport produced from biomass and in bioliquids which are liquid fuel for energy purposes other than for transport, including electricity, heating and cooling; c) new provisions are set forth with regard to the application of sustainability criteria for biofuels and bioliquids, so as to lay down clear rules for the calculation of greenhouse gas emissions from biofuels and bioliquids and their fossil fuel comparators; d) the Office for Sustainability Monitoring of Biofuels and Bioliquids is established at the General Secretariat of Energy and Climate Change with the objective to follow-up and certify that the production of biofuels and bioliquids meets the above-mentioned sustainability criteria; e) new provisions are set forth with regard to further promoting renewable sources of energy; this is related to additional administrative processes, regulations and Codes, as well as additional related procedures on information and training; f) Law No. 3054/2002 is supplemented and amended with certain provisions establishing a mechanism for the follow-up and the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from the use of fuels in road and rail transport, as well as the obligation of special labelling for bio-fuel in retail sale points; g) Law No. 4001/2011 is supplemented and amended relating to the bearing and sharing of costs of technical adaptations, which are necessary in order to integrate new producers feeding electricity produced from renewable energy sources into the interconnected grid.
Subject: Energy

Policy: European Communities (Conservation of Wild Birds (Corofin Wetlands Special Protection Area 004220)) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 117 of 2012).
Policy_Content: These Regulations designate a foreshore area as a Special Protection Area in accordance with Article 4 of Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Conservation of Wild Birds. The area is set out in Schedules 1 and 2. The purpose is to protect all species of birds to which Article 4 relates and in particular those listed in Schedule 3 to these Regulations from disturbance, capture and damage to nests and eggs. Schedule 4 lists activities that require the consent of the Minister and may cause disturbance or damage to birds protected under Schedule 3. The bird species listed in that Schedule are protected to ensure their survival and reproduction in their area of distribution. Activities listed in Schedule 4 include: cutting, uprooting or otherwise removing plants, except for agricultural purposes; introduction of plants or animals not found in the area; drainage works; water abstraction; and planting of trees or multi-annual bioenergy crops.

Policy: Decreto Nº 1179 - Ley de Desarrollo Rural Sustentable del Estado de Oaxaca. Texto consolidado.
Policy_Content: Las disposiciones de esta Ley son de orden público e interés social y están  orientadas a promover el Desarrollo Rural Sustentable del Estado. Se considera de interés público el desarrollo rural sustentable que incluye la planeación y  organización de la producción agropecuaria, su industrialización y comercialización y de los demás bienes, servicios y todas aquellas tendientes a elevar la calidad de vida de la  población rural. Son sujetos de esta Ley de conformidad con la Ley Agraria, los núcleos de  población ejidales o ejidos, comunales, indígenas, pequeños propietarios, las sociedades y  organizaciones o asociaciones rurales de carácter Estatal, regional distrital, municipal o ejidal y comunitario, de productores del medio rural que se  constituyan o estén constituidos conforme a las leyes vigentes, y en general toda persona  física o moral que de manera individual o colectiva realice preponderantemente  actividades de producción en el medio rural. El texto de la Ley se compone de los siguientes Títulos: I) Disposiciones generales; II) De la planeación y coordinación de la política para el desarrollo rural sustentable; III) Del fomento del desarrollo rural sustentable; IV) De los apoyos económicos.

Policy: Order No. 82 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the national park “Losiny Ostrov”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Losiny Ostrov” shall be Moscow region of the Russian Federation. National park “Losiny Ostrov” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities not related to the functioning of the national park; (f) clear cutting for timber extraction; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting, commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible and non-edible non-timber forest resources; (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) application and storage of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means; (s) washing vehicles outside authorized areas; and (t) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Décret D/2012/041/PRG/SGG du 26 mars 2012 portant attributions, composition et fonctionnement de la commission nationale des mines.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée une commission dénommée Commission Nationale des Mines, composée des représentants de l'Etat et des autres composantes de la Nation, en application des dispositions des articles 1 et 9 du code minier.  La Commission Nationale des Mines participe à l'examen des dossiers d'attribution, de prorogation, de renouvellement, d'amodiation et de retrait des titres miniers sur la base des dispositions du Code minier. Son rôle varie en fonction de la nature du Titre minier concerné. En ce qui concerne le Permis de recherche, l'avis simple de la Commission Nationale des Mines n'est requis qu'en cas de contestation par le titulaire de toute décision relative au renouvellement ou au retrait, et particulièrement à la rétrocession des périmètres accompagnés de toutes les informations géologiques. Pour le Permis d'exploitation et la concession, l’avis favorable de la Commission Nationale des Mines est requis pour toute décision relative a l'approbation des études de faisabilité et d'impact environnemental et social, au renouvellement et au retrait de ce titre. Pour la Concession minière, l'avis favorable de la Commission Nationale des Mines est également requis pour toute décision relative à la signature, au retrait, à l'annulation ainsi qu'à la cession totale ou partielle des droits consacres par la Convention.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Western Africa

Policy: Ley Nº 11 - Establece un régimen especial para la protección de los recursos minerales, hídricos y ambientales en la Comarca Ngäbe-Buglé.

Este régimen especial será aplicable también a las comunidades Ngäbe-Buglé adyacentes a las áreas anexas, definidas, delimitadas y acordes con las disposiciones legales vigentes. Se reconoce el derecho de la comarca en relación con el uso, manejo y aprovechamiento tradicional sostenible de los recursos naturales renovables, ubicados dentro de su área. Estos recursos deberán utilizarse de acuerdo con los fines de protección y conservación del ambiente, establecidos en la Constitución Política de la República, la presente Ley y las demás leyes nacionales. Se crea el Fondo para el Desarrollo de la Comarca Ngäbe-Buglé.

Policy: Law No. 4061 on the management and protection of the immovable property of the Ministry of Rural Development and Food − Regulation of property rights and other provisions.
Policy_Content: Agricultural and rural regulations in Greece are governed by a scattered legislation, making its use and application difficult. Such situation does not correspond to the modern needs, since the management of the agricultural immovable property is applied through the Rural Code which was ratified in 1949, together with certain legislative provisions on rural development during the ’70s and ’80s. Moreover, the Ministry of Rural Development and Food manages the immovable property on the basis of other laws and provisions, in particular with Law No. 3147/2003 (articles 4 and 9), as supplemented with 12 of Law No. 3208/2003 and the article 4 (paragraph 3) of Law No. 2215/1994. The terms that are currently being used for “immovable property” managed by the Ministry are many and create problems on the interpretation of the law. Specifically, the terms “communal and available extents”, “lots”, “plots” and others are being used, as these are defined in articles 31, 123 and 184 of the Rural Code, in article of 24 of Law 1644/1986 and in the Legislative Decree No. 203/1969. With the provisions of the present law is established a) the unified use of the term “immovable property”, in which are included all the above mentioned definitions, such as rural extents, parcels, plots, pasture lands, etc ; b) it is clarified that the Ministry of Rural Development and Food manages this immovable property on behalf of the Greek State; c) a unified institutional framework is applied for all the immovable property falling under the competence of the Ministry and d) the administrative actions, procedures (concession, lease, ownership rights, etc) and governing bodies for this property are defined. The law consists of 44 articles.

Policy: Chain Saw Milling Regulation (FDA Regulation No. 115-11).
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Forestry Development Authority (FDA) regulates chain saw milling in order to optimize its positive benefits and also mitigate its negative effects. It establishes a structured process by which authorization for chain saw milling is requested, reviewed, and granted or denied. Its object is to ensure that chain saw milling is carried out in an environmentally appropriate manner and through procedures and practices that promote the mutual interests of chain sawyers, communities and sustainable forest management in Liberia. Chain saw milling permits shall be issued for operations only in Community forests and private or deeded forest land. The area must be identified by the FDA as suitable for commercial use and validated in accordance with the National Forestry Reform Law of 2006. A permit holder must receive both a written permission from the FDA and the Free Prior Informed Consent of the community in community forest areas or the private land owner.

Policy_Content: The Regulation is based on the Afghanistan Seeds Law and aim to regulates farm inspection in the country.   The Regulation consists of 3 Chapters, which divided into 11 articles: General Provisions (I); Duties and Responsibilities (II); Final Provisions (III).  The main objective of this Regulation is to inspect and control the technical facilities of farms in order to produce the high-quality, safe and pure seeds. The farms inspectors are responsible to: participate in seeds quality control trainings of the FAO; inspect farms of the contract farmers and corporative who produces seeds; collect data and report to the Department of Cereal Production and Development; collect samples and send them to the laboratory for taking necessary tests; register sample seeds in the laboratory’s database; approve or disapprove the improved seeds; cooperate with FAO’s staff. According to the Regulation, FAO office in Afghanistan is responsible to provide training courses for farms’ inspectors, provide better facilities for laboratories, and cooperate in farm inspection process and examinations in the laboratories. The Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock is the authority responsible to implement the provisions of this Regulation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Landlocked Developing Countries, Least Developed Countries, Southern Asia

Policy: Order No. 60 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Pleshcheyevo lake”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Pleshcheyevo lake” shall be Yaroslavl region of the Russian Federation. National park “Pleshcheyevo lake” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial hunting and  commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; application of  chemicals, mineral fertilizers and nutrients (except for land plots used by owners and tenants for agricultural purposes); (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (y) walking unleashed dogs; and (z) ploughing up of the territory (except for forest fire fighting purposes).

Policy: National Agriculture Sector Strategy 2012 - 2016
Policy_Content: This National Agriculture Sector Strategy (NASS)for the five year period 2012 – 2016 is a multi-sectoral document which aims to provide a comprehensive guide to the development of agriculture sector, with a special focus on the farmer, and what is needed to improve productivity and increase economic returns. Main objectives in the agriculture sector are: to raise domestic food production through improvement in input supply; to increase farmer awareness, and expand availability of agricultural credit; to fight poverty in the rural community, identified as one of the poorest and most vulnerable segments of the Yemeni population, through higher income to farmers and increased rural employment; to preserve the environment and natural resources, and activate the role of community participation to ensure sustainability; to improve marketing efficiency, decrease post harvest losses and develop exporting capacities.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 56/2012 approving the structure of the Portuguese Environment Agency (IP).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 18 articles, creates the Portuguese Environment Agency (APA IP) as a public institution, with administrative and financial autonomy. APA IP, is responsible for the tasks of the Ministry of Agriculture, Sea, Environment and Spatial Planning, under the supervision of the respective ministers. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the APA IP, which is entitled to propose, develop and monitor the integrated management and subsidiary of environmental policies and sustainable development, in coordination with other sectoral policies and with public and private entities that work for the same purpose. The duties of the APA IP, aim at implementing environmentally sustainable policy as follows: proposing, developing and monitoring the implementation of environmental policies, particularly in the context of fighting climate change, water management, waste, protection of the ozone layer and air quality standards, recovery and enhancement of soil and other contaminated areas, the integrated prevention and control of pollution, noise, major industrial risks, environmental safety, ecological labelling, environmental management systems, as well as the environmental impact assessment of plans and programs, etc.

Policy_Content: The National Social Protection Strategy and Plan of Action was prepared by the Government of Saint Kitts and Nevis to establish the main priorities for social protection policy making and reform over the period 2013-2017; and to guide the establishment of a sustainable, comprehensive and integrated social protection system for Saint Kitts and Nevis.
