Policy: Law No. 12.372 establishing the State Policy on Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming (PEATER) and State Programme of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming (PROATER).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 25 articles divided into six Chapters, establishes the State Policy on Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming (PEATER) and State Programme of Technical Assistance and Rural Extension for Family Farming (PROATER). PEATER formulation and supervision are under the responsibility of the State Secretariat of Agriculture, Irrigation and Agrarian Reform (SEAGRI), through the Family Farming Superintendency (SUAF). PEATER objectives aim to: promote sustainable rural development; support economic initiatives that promote territorial potentials and vocations; increase quality and productivity of agricultural and non-agricultural activities and services, including forestry and artisanal services; promote the improvement of the quality of life; advise the various phases of economic activities; develop actions aimed at the use, management, protection, conservation and recovery of natural resources, agroecosystems and biodiversity; build sustainable production systems based on scientific, empirical and traditional knowledge; increase beneficiary income and add value to their production; support societies and cooperatives, as well as the training of technical assistance and rural extension agents; promote the development of technological and organizational innovations for target public and its integration into the national productive market; contribute to the expansion of learning, education and professional qualification, in a diversified, appropriate and contextualized way to the reality of the Brazilian rural environment, etc.

Policy: Customs Management Act, 2011 (No. 22 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for matters concerning customs control and places restrictions on the importation and exportation of goods. The Act also prohibits the import of prohibited goods into Seychelles and gives power to the Minister to prohibit by Regulations the importation into Seychelles of- (a) any specified goods; or (b) goods of a specified class or classes. The Assistant Commissioner of Customs may, under the provision for prohibited and restricted imports, restrict or otherwise control the entry of certain goods from entering Seychelles. The Act also concerns duties or taxes or levies on waste and scrap. All goods brought into Seychelles shall from the time of their entry be subject to - (a) Customs control or supervision; and (b) be subject to prohibitions and restrictions, justified on grounds of public morality; public security, the protection of the health and life of humans, animals or plants, the environment, the national treasures, relics, the implementation of fishery conservation or the protection of industrial or commercial property including any prohibited goods.

Policy: Decree No. 45.834 establishing the Regulation of the State Institute of Forests (IEF).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 9 Chapters, establishes the Regulation of the State Institute of Forests (IEF). This forestry institution aims at the following activities: implementing State forestry policy and promoting the preservation and conservation of fauna and flora, promoting the sustainable development of renewable natural resources and fisheries, as well as carrying out researches on biomass and biodiversity. The IEF is also competent for: coordinating, orientating, developing, promoting and supervising the implementation of activities and researches related to biodiversity protection, promotion of mapping, cadastre and monitoring of plant biosphere, protection of wild fauna and aquatic animals, preparing a list of endangered species within the State, reforestation of trees and rehabilitation of depressed areas and natural land and aquatic ecosystems; and carry out other related activities.

Policy: Land Title Registration Act 2011 (No. 51 of 2011).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the registration of title in land in the Bermudas. It establishes the Land Title Registry Office and defines the general powers of registrar. This Act does not affect the law of property in Bermuda as it applies to estates, interests or dealings in land that are not registered or required to be registered under this Act. The registrar shall establish and maintain the land title register and the cautions register. The cautions register shall include an individual register for each caution against the first registration of title to an unregistered estate. The Act provides for caution against first registration. It also defines powers of an owner in relation to a registered estate and provides with respect to creation and severance of tenancy in common, trustees, settlement of registered estates, adverse possession and prescription.

Policy: Regional Law No. 888-PK “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. Subjects of public control shall be: (a) citizens and associations thereof; and (b) regional group of public (civic) control and members thereof. Objects of public control shall be: (a) regional state bodies; (b) local government; (c) regional state and municipal organizations; and (d) other organizations performing some public functions. Public control can be performed in the form of public audit. Public control shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of rights and duties of citizens, and legal interests thereof; (b) legitimacy; (c) openness and transparency; and (d) absence of prohibition of performance of public (civic) control in other forms than those envisaged by this Regional Law.

Policy: Order No. 190 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the General Requirements for the system of nuclear energy management.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes mandatory general requirements for the development, implementation, evaluation and continuous improvement of the management system for activities in the field of nuclear energy use. System of management of activities in the field of nuclear energy use shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of the fulfillment of safety requirements over economic, technical, scientific and other purposes; (b) ensuring constant and systematic control over compliance with safety requirements; (c) ensuring the planning, management and supervision of activities that affect security in normal, transitional and emergency conditions; (d) formation and maintenance of a culture of security and a culture of protection; (e) establishment of personal responsibility of the top management for the priority allocation of resources necessary for the fulfillment of security requirements; and (f) prevention of violations of safety requirements through continuous analysis of its activities and implementation of corrective and preventive measures. System of management of activities in the field of nuclear energy must include radiation safety and environmental security arrangements.

Policy: Subsoil Code (Law No. HO-280-N).
Policy_Content: This Code establishes the principles and procedure for use of natural resources in the territory of the Republic of Armenia, the relations connected with management and conversion of waste of subsoil use, environmental protection from harmful effects in the process of subsoil management, work safety, and also protection of the rights and legitimate interests of the state and persons during use of natural resources are governed. Subsoil shall be intended the part of crust located on depth below soil layer, and in case of its absence - below the Earth's surface and bottom of reservoirs and water currents which is available for the use of natural resources. Geological exploration shall be intended complex of geological works in subsoil which purpose is to study the structure of crust, conditions of formation of mineral layers, exogenous geological processes, volcanic activities, and also identification and assessment of inventories of minerals. Subsoil user shall be intended the legal entity (including the commercial organization of foreign state) performing use of natural resources according to this Code. Main provisions of legal regulation of relationships associated with mining and subsoil protection shall be as follows: (a) ensuring security of population and protection of nature and environment; (b) recognizing subsoil as the exclusive property of the state; (c) development and implementation of state programs in the field of mining and subsoil protection; (d) implementation of state control over mining and subsoil protection; (e) implementation of state inventory of mineral  reserves, balance calculation, administration of state register of mines, outcrops and state registration of geological explorations; (f) ensuring reasonable complex utilization of mines; (g) performance of state expert examination in the field of mining and subsoil protection; (h) implementation of state standardization in the field of mining and subsoil protection; (i) transparency of activities related to mining; and (j) payment for the use of minerals. Subsoil of the Republic of Armenia is the exclusive domain of the State, which may be allotted for use only for purposes of geological explorations and mining. Any parts of subsoil may not be subject to purchase and sale, pledging, or alienation in any other form. Geological information shall be provided free of charge, whereby the authorized body shall be paid only for services on provision of information in accordance with the procedure established by the Government. Public administration of mining and subsoil protection, as well as mining related nature and environmental protection is conducted by the Government and public administration bodies authorized in this field within the scope of their authorities. Exploration and mining activities shall be regulated by contracts (agreements). Period of validity of geological exploration authorization shall be for a period not exceeding 3 years, which may be extended for 3 consecutive times, each time not exceeding 2 years. Period of validity of mining authorization shall be for the whole term of mining operation, however for not more than 50 years, which shall be estimated in accordance with technical and economic indicators of mining of the given deposit. This Subsoil Code consists of 11 Chapters divided into 81 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state regulation of mining sector. Chapter 3 regards mining rights. Chapter 4 regards mining for the purpose of geological exploration. Chapter 5 regards mining for the purpose of mineral extraction. Chapter 6 regards application of fees for mineral extraction. Chapter 7 establishes the procedure for state registration of mining fields. Chapter 8 regards preservation of nature, environment and subsoil in the process of mining. Chapter 9 regards state supervision over mining and subsoil protection. Chapter 10 regards dispute settlement. Chapter 11 lays down transitional and final provisions.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia

Elle est chargée de la conception, de l’exécution et du suivi de la politique de l’Etat en matière de conservation et de restauration des sols, notamment parmi ses missions se trouvent entre autres, le pilotage du programme national de reboisement et la surveillance de la protection des bassins versants, ainsi que l’encouragement et la promotion de la participation populaire et l’éducation écologique, l’accent étant mis sur la lutte contre la désertification et la gestion des conséquences de la sécheresse, par le biais notamment, d’une gestion rationnelle des ressources en sols et des ressources hydriques.

Policy: Loi n° 2011/025 du 14 décembre 2011 portant valorisation des gaz associés.
Policy_Content: La présente loi vise à limiter le phénomène de torchage qui fait perdre d’énormes quantités de gaz au Cameroun; elle veut également valoriser les gaz récupérés pour booster le potentiel gazeux, et donc répondre au mieux à la demande interne en énergie électrique et en gaz domestique, le tout dans un régime fiscal qui incite à l’investissement, en même temps qu’il vient combler un vide juridique qui existe en matière de gaz associés. La valorisation des gaz associés vise donc à promouvoir la récupération des gaz actuellement rejetés ou torchés, pour leur commercialisation;créer un environnement contractuel et fiscal susceptible d'inciter tout titulaire de contret pétrolier à valoriser les gaz associés; contribuer à la réduction des gaz à effet de serre et à la protection de l'environnement.

Policy: Loi n° 2011/022 du 14 décembre 2011 régissant le secteur de l'électricité au Cameroun.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit l’électricité au Cameroun en vue de sa modernisation et de son développement. La réforme entreprise se fonde sur la nécessité d'accompagner le développement d'une véritable industrie lourde dans le secteur de l’électricité, par la mise en place d'une meilleure sécurité juridique, assortie d'un système de régulation appropriée. L'électricité est considérée comme bien meuble par nature, consomptible et fongible La loi s'applique aux activités de production à partir de toute sources primaire ou secondaire d'énergie, de transport, de distribution, de fourniture, d'importation, d'exportation et de vente de l'électricité, réalisées par toute personne physique ou morale sur le territoire camerounais. A ce titre: la loi fixe les modalités de stockage d'eau en vue de la production de l'électricité, de production, de transport de distribution, d'importation, d'exportation et de vente d'électricité; établit les bases d'une saine concurrence dans le secteur de l'électricité en vue d'en accroître l'efficacité économique; fixe les modalités de contrôle de l'exécution des obligations spécifiques mises à la charge des opérateurs des activités non concurrentielles; précise les règles de protection de l'environnement, dans le secteur de l'électricité; précise les règles de protection des intérêts des consommateurs sur le plan des tarifs, des conditions de fourniture d'électricité et de sécurité des services; garantit la continuité et la qualité des prestations.
Subject: Energy
